cities.name: Caracas
cities.description: Venezuela's vibrant capital city with colonial architecture, mountain views, and rich culture

challenges.caption: Visit the historic Plaza Bolivar and take a photo with the statue
Try an authentic Venezuelan arepa at a local restaurant
Find and photograph a colorful street art mural
Take the cable car up to Avila mountain and enjoy the view
Have breakfast with a traditional cachapa
Visit the historic Caracas Cathedral
Explore a local market and try fresh tropical fruit
Take a photo at the iconic Parque Central towers
Enjoy a traditional pabellón criollo meal
Ride the Caracas metro system
Share tequeños with friends at a café
Visit the Teresa Carreño Cultural Center
Take a peaceful walk through the Botanical Garden
Try the famous Venezuelan quesillo dessert
Photograph a beautiful colonial house facade
Visit the Museum of Fine Arts
Grab a fresh empanada from a street vendor
Relax by the lake at Parque del Este
Find someone playing the traditional cuatro instrument
Pay respects at the Panteón Nacional
Buy a handmade souvenir from a local artisan
Capture the Caracas skyline at night
Try the traditional chicha beverage
Watch a street performer and leave a tip

cities.name: Cádiz
cities.description: Culture & History · Nature & Outdoors · Food & Drink · Movement & Exploration · Nightlife & Ambience · Photo & Video Challenges

challenges.caption: Stroll along La Caleta Beach at sunset and feel like you’re walking through a movie scene.
Climb the Torre Tavira for panoramic views and a fascinating peek through the Camera Obscura.
Get lost in Cádiz’s Old Town streets and find a tiny tapas bar to grab a quick bite.
Marvel at the golden dome of Cádiz Cathedral and enjoy the breezy plaza surrounding it.
Explore the ancient Roman Theatre and imagine the performances that once filled its stands.
Admire the colorful flower stalls and lively atmosphere of Plaza de las Flores as you soak in the heart of local life.
Step inside the Cádiz Museum to uncover Phoenician, Roman, and modern treasures. Find the two Phoenician sarcophagi on the ground floor — they’re the stars of the collection.
Take a relaxed walk through Parque Genovés and admire its beautifully sculpted greenery.
Walk the entire causeway to Castillo de San Sebastián and take a picture where the waves crash against the walkway.
Visit the Castillo de Santa Catalina for coastal views and inspiring art exhibitions. Find a photo from the 1947 explosion that shows its devastation.
Dive into the Mercado Central and taste fresh seafood straight from the Atlantic.
Wander along the Paseo Marítimo and enjoy ocean breezes and cheerful local energy.
Grab a drink at "Circo Duende Arte + Bar" and soak in Cádiz’s lively nightlife with its cozy vibe and live music.
Join a Carnival workshop or event to feel the spirit of Spain’s most iconic festival.
Take a day trip to charming nearby beaches like Playa de la Victoria.
Enjoy churros with chocolate at a traditional café for an irresistible morning treat.
Rent a bike and explore the coastline at your own pace.
Listen to live flamenco and feel the emotion of authentic Andalusian culture.
Sail or kayak around the bay for a refreshing look at the city from the water.
Visit the Oratorio de San Felipe Neri, birthplace of Spain’s first constitution.
Try tortillitas de camarones, Cádiz’s crispy shrimp fritters, and savor local flavor.
Walk through the narrow streets of Barrio La Viña and snap a photo of its colorful facades.
Catch a local performance at the Gran Teatro Falla and revel in its magnificent setting.
Simply sit by the sea with an ice cream and appreciate how Cádiz makes time slow down.

cities.name: Madrid
cities.description: Madrid blends royal landmarks, world-class art, and a buzzing food scene into a city made for wandering. From sunny plazas to late-night tapas, every neighborhood has its own rhythm. It’s vibrant, warm, and always alive — the perfect place to explore, taste, and get a little lost.

challenges.caption: El Retiro Park – Go to El Retiro Park and rent a rowboat to paddle around the lake.
Puerta del Sol – Go around the statue of el Oso y el Madroño and touch its tail for good luck.
Plaza Mayor – Sit on the square eating a classic calamari sandwich (bocadillo de calamares) with alioli.
Gran Vía – See if you can spot Bumblebee (from Transformers) and get a photo with him.
El Rastro – Find a vintage item for under 5€ (bargaining is encouraged). Make sure that you on a Sunday before it closes at 3pm.
Royal Palace – Find the armor of King Charles V.
Malasaña – Go on a pub crawl and try every kind of beer.
Bernabéu Stadium – Find the pub inside the stadium and enjoy a drink (and the view).
Plaza de España – Walk around the square and see how many mini fountains you can spot.
Mercado de San Miguel – Go to this local market and try a tapa you have never tasted before.
Templo de Debod – Go the temple and enjoy one of the best sunset views in Madrid.
Almudena Cathedral – Climb to the top and see if you if you can spot the tiny angel statue hidden on the rooftop.
Museo del Prado – See if you can find the “Meninas”, one of the most famous paintings inside the museum.
Casa de Campo – Take the cable car for an epic view of the city.
La Latina – Get a drink at one of those iconic wooden barrels that double as standing tables.
Atocha Monument — Stand under the “Forest of the Absent” and count how many trees you can see without moving your feet.
Plaza de Colón – Go on a bench and enjoy a well-deserved break after a long day of walking around.
Lavapiés – Go to the square and try a non-Spanish dish.
Chamberí Ghost Station — Step onto the old platform and try to spot the original 1919 tile ads that are still perfectly preserved.
Faro de Moncloa — Ride up to the observation deck and try to identify at least three Madrid landmarks from above without checking your phone.
Crystal Palace (inside el Retiro) – Capture your reflection in the glass for an artistic shot.
Ponzano – Go to this famous street and try to meet local people and enjoy a drink.
Paseo la Castellana – Take a stroll in this iconic avenue.
Plaza de Olavide – Go to this square and enjoy an afternoon like a real Madrileño.
